titleStmt.title: Samuel Gowen and Donald Webster v. JH McGraw. Writ.

bibl.title: Samuel Gowen and Donald Webster v. JH McGraw. Writ.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.ab: In the District Court Holding Terms at Seattle, Wash. Ter.
The People of the United States of America To the Sheriff of King County Greeting
div1.p: you that you have the bodies of Samuel Gowen and Donald Webster by you imprisioned and detained and is said, togehter with the time and cause of such imprisionment and detention, by whatsoever names said Samuel Gowen and Donald Webster shall be called or charged, before the Hon. Roger S. Greene Judge of the aforesaid court at his chambers in the city of Seattle in the County of King on the 26th day of Feburary 1883, at 10 o'clock in the forenoon of said day to do and recieve what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Samuel Gowen and Donald Webster And have you then and there this writ.
div1.ab: Witness the Hon. Roger S Greene Judge of said District Court and the seal threat 24th day of Feburary AD 1883
James Seavey Clerk By James P Ludlow Dupty.
No. In Re Samuel Gowen and Donald Webster Habeas Corpus Writ Filed Feburary 27th 1883 James Seavey, Clerk. By James P Ludlow Deputy Clerk. Hall + Wood for Applicants
